intro: Lobelia siphilitica var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf blue lobelia, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its small, tubular blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, making it a compact and ornamental species. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
